verses.text: If thou wilt return, O Israel, saith the LORD, return to me: and if thou wilt put away thy abominations out of my sight, then shalt thou not remove.
And thou shalt swear, The LORD liveth, in truth, in judgment, and in righteousness; and the nations shall bless themselves in him, and in him shall they glory.
For thus saith the LORD to the men of Judah and Jerusalem, Break up your fallow ground, and sow not among thorns.

Circumcise yourselves to the LORD, and take away the foreskins of your heart, ye men of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem: lest my fury come forth like fire, and burn that none can quench \add it\add* , because of the evil of your doings.
Declare ye in Judah, and publish in Jerusalem; and say, Blow ye the trumpet in the land: cry, Gather together, and say, Assemble yourselves, and let us go into the fortified cities.
Set up the standard towards Zion: retire, stay not: for I will bring evil from the north, and a great destruction.

The lion is come up from his thicket, and the destroyer of the Gentiles is on his way; he is gone forth from his place to make thy land desolate; thy cities shall be laid waste, without an inhabitant.
For this gird you with sackcloth, lament and howl for the fierce anger of the LORD is not turned back from us.

And it shall come to pass at that day, saith the LORD, \add that\add* the heart of the king shall perish, and the heart of the princes; and the priests shall be astonished, and the prophets shall wonder.
Then said I, Ah, Lord GOD! surely thou hast greatly deceived this people and Jerusalem, saying, Ye shall have peace; whereas the sword reacheth to the soul.
At that time shall it be said to this people and to Jerusalem, A dry wind of the high places in the wilderness towards the daughter of my people, not to fan, nor to cleanse,
\add Even\add* a full wind from those \add places\add* shall come to me: now also will I give sentence against them.
Behold, he shall come up as clouds, and his chariots \add shall be\add* as a whirlwind: his horses are swifter than eagles. Woe to us! for we are laid waste.
O Jerusalem, wash thy heart from wickedness, that thou mayest be saved. How long shall thy vain thoughts lodge within thee?
For a voice declareth from Dan, and publisheth affliction from mount Ephraim.
Make ye mention to the nations; behold, publish against Jerusalem, \add that\add* watchers come from a far country, and give out their voice against the cities of Judah.
As keepers of a field they are against her on all sides; because she hath been rebellious against me, saith the LORD.
Thy way and thy doings have procured these \add things\add* to thee; this \add is\add* thy wickedness, because it is bitter, because it reacheth to thy heart.
My bowels, my bowels! I am pained at my very heart; my heart maketh a noise in me; I cannot hold my peace, because thou hast heard, O my soul, the sound of the trumpet, the alarm of war.
Destruction upon destruction is cried; for the whole land is laid waste; suddenly are my tents ruined, \add and\add* my curtains in a moment.
How long shall I see the standard, \add and\add* hear the sound of the trumpet?

For my people \add are\add* foolish, they have not known me; they \add are\add* sottish children, and they have no understanding: they \add are\add* wise to do evil, but to do good they have no knowledge.
I beheld the earth, and lo, \add it was\add* without form, and void; and the heavens, and they \add had\add* no light.
I beheld the mountains, and lo, they trembled, and all the hills moved lightly.
I beheld, and lo, \add there was\add* no man, and all the fowls of the heavens had fled.
I beheld, and lo, the fruitful place \add was\add* a wilderness, and all its cities were broken down at the presence of the LORD, \add and\add* by his fierce anger.
For thus hath the LORD said, The whole land shall be desolate; yet will I not make a full end.
For this shall the earth mourn, and the heavens above be black: because I have spoken \add it\add* , I have purposed \add it\add* , and will not repent, neither will I turn back from it.
The whole city shall flee for the noise of the horsemen and bowmen; they shall go into thickets, and climb up upon the rocks: every city \add shall be\add* forsaken, and not a man dwell therein.

And \add when\add* thou \add art\add* laid waste, what wilt thou do? Though thou clothest thyself with crimson, though thou deckest thee with ornaments of gold, though thou rendest thy face with painting, in vain shalt thou make thyself fair: \add thy\add* lovers will despise thee, they will seek thy life.

For I have heard a voice as of a woman in travail, \add and\add* the anguish as of her that bringeth forth her first child, the voice of the daughter of Zion, \add that\add* bewaileth herself, \add that\add* spreadeth her hands, \add saying\add* , Woe \add is\add* me now! for my soul is wearied because of murderers.
